node.title: An issue with peacock
node.bodyText:
Hello
I have an issue with using Peacock on WSL in the Windows system.
After the installation process, I was trying to run the example file.
mamba activate moose
cd ~/projects/moose/tutorials/darcy_thermo_mech/step01_diffusion/problems
~/projects/moose/python/peacock/peacock -i step1.i
However, I received the message:

qt.qpa.plugin: Could not load the Qt platform plugin "xcb" in "" even though it was found.
This application failed to start because no Qt platform plugin could be initialized. Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.
Available platform plugins are: eglfs, minimal, minimalegl, offscreen, vnc, webgl, xcb.

When I try this:
../darcy_thermo_mech-opt -i step1.i
Everything is fine, it returns 'Solve Converged!'
The xeyes works well, and I also enabled the ''Disable access control'' when using VcXsrv, so I'm not sure what's going on :(
Does anyone have a similar experience?

Hello guys
I eventually found that after using this in the base env, then activate moose and run the codes, all is well :)
sudo apt install libxcb-*
I'll add this to our instructions! 🍻

node.title: Showing PointValue in Paraview
node.bodyText:
Hello, I was wondering if there is any way to display the PointValue in Paraview to see it at the same time as the mesh. I have a model of a plate and the PointValue represents a thermocouple on the surface of the model and I would like to see it in Paraview.
Thanks in advance.

Hello
PointValue will be read as a global variable in Paraview. It will be shown as a unique value over the whole mesh.
You can definitely plot its time dependence in paraview
Guillaume

node.title: Connecting temperature to a function
node.bodyText:
Hello, I am trying to pass the temperature to the expression of my function to be dependant on the temperature and change value from 1 to 0 when T is less than 1100 degrees. For the temperature evolution I am using a heat source in the "Materials" block that moves over my model and it is called "vol_heat". I am not sure how to use the 'T' for my expression because it tell me that "no variable 'vol_heat' found for substitution expression". How can I pass the temperature to my expression? Thank you in advance.
[./val_function]
type = ParsedFunction
expression = 'if(T<1100,1,0)'
symbol_names = 'T'
symbol_values = vol_heat
[../]

Hello
Functions are meant to depend on spatial location and time not really variables.
You should look at using a material property instead. For example the ParsedMaterial
Guillaume

Thank you! And then if I want to pass that ParsedMaterial to an AuxKernels?
[Materials]
  [./val_function]
    type = ParsedMaterial
    expression = 'if(T<1100,1,0)'
    coupled_variables = 'T'
  [../]
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [./val1]
    type = FunctionAux
    variable = val1
    function = val_function
  [../]
[]

There is a MaterialRealAux if you want to output to an auxvariable.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/auxkernels/MaterialRealAux.html
Thanks!

node.title: A problem about the body force
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I was trying to solve the 2D Navier-Stokes equation. I want to add the body force to the momentum equation, and the expression of the body force is VyCos(x)Sin(y)-VxSin(y)^2 in the x-axis, VxCos(x)Sin(y)-VyCos(x)^2 in the y-axis, where Vx and Vy are velocity components. I tried many combinations of codes, but the programs always had bugs. The reason for the bugs is the BodyForce block needs to add the expressions from the Function block. How to solve this problem?
Thanks.
The complete code is attached as follows:
`[Mesh]
[gen]
type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
dim = 2
xmin = 0
xmax = 1.0
ymin = 0
ymax = 1.0
nx = 64
ny = 64
elem_type = QUAD9
[]
[./corner_node]
type = ExtraNodesetGenerator
new_boundary = 'pinned_node'
nodes = '0'
input = gen
[../]
[]
[AuxVariables]
[./vel_x]
order = SECOND
[../]
[./vel_y]
order = SECOND
[../]
[]
[AuxKernels]
[./vel_x]
type = VectorVariableComponentAux
variable = vel_x
vector_variable = velocity
component = 'x'
[../]
[./vel_y]
type = VectorVariableComponentAux
variable = vel_y
vector_variable = velocity
component = 'y'
[../]
[./bodyfx]
type = FunctionAux
variable = bodyfx
function = 'vel_y*cos(x)sin(y) - vel_xsin(y)sin(y)'
[../]
[./bodyfy]
type = FunctionAux
variable = bodyfy
function = 'vel_xcos(x)sin(y) - vel_ycos(x)*cos(x)'
[../]
[]
[Variables]
[./velocity]
order = SECOND
family = LAGRANGE_VEC
[../]
[./T]
  order = SECOND
  [./InitialCondition]
    type = ConstantIC
    value = 1.0
  [../]
[../]

[./p]
[../]

[]
[Kernels]
[./mass]
type = INSADMass
variable = p
[../]
[./momentum_time]
  type = INSADMomentumTimeDerivative
  variable = velocity
[../]

[./momentum_convection]
  type = INSADMomentumAdvection
  variable = velocity
[../]

[./momentum_viscous]
  type = INSADMomentumViscous
  variable = velocity
[../]

[./momentum_pressure]
  type = INSADMomentumPressure
  variable = velocity
  pressure = p
  integrate_p_by_parts = true
[../]
  
[./gravity]
  type = INSADGravityForce
  variable = velocity
  gravity = '0 -9.81 0'
[../]

[./bodyforce]      
  type = VectorBodyForce
  variable = velocity
  function_x = 'v_y*cos(x)*sin(y) - v_x*sin(y)*sin(y)'
  function_y = 'v_x*cos(x)*sin(y) - v_y*cos(x)*cos(x)'
[../]

[./temperature_time]
type = INSADHeatConductionTimeDerivative
variable = T
[../]
[./temperature_advection]
type = INSADEnergyAdvection
variable = T
[../]
[./temperature_conduction]
type = ADHeatConduction
variable = T
thermal_conductivity = 'k'
[../]
[]
[BCs]
[./no_slip]
type = VectorFunctionDirichletBC
variable = velocity
boundary = 'bottom right left'
[../]
[./lid]
  type = VectorFunctionDirichletBC
  variable = velocity
  boundary = 'top'
  function_x = 'lid_function'
[../]

[./T_hot]
  type = DirichletBC
  variable = T
  boundary = 'top'
  value = 1
[../]

[./T_cold]
  type = DirichletBC
  variable = T
  boundary = 'bottom'
  value = 0
[../]

[./pressure_pin]
  type = DirichletBC
  variable = p
  boundary = 'pinned_node'
  value = 0
[../]

[]
[Materials]
[./const]
type = ADGenericConstantMaterial
prop_names = 'rho mu cp k'
prop_values = '8  1.5  0.4  50'
[../]
[./ins_mat]
type = INSAD3Eqn
velocity = velocity
pressure = p
temperature = T
[../]
[./v_x]
type = ParsedMaterial
f_name = 'v_x'
function = 'vel_x'
args = 'vel_x'
[../]
[./v_y]
type = ParsedMaterial
f_name = 'v_y'
function = 'vel_y'
args = 'vel_y'
[../]
[]
[Functions]
[./lid_function]
type = ParsedFunction
expression = '2x-3y'
[../]
[]
[Preconditioning]
[./SMP]
type = SMP
full = true
solve_type = 'NEWTON'
[../]
[]
[Executioner]
type = Transient
num_steps = 400
dt = .0005
dtmax = .005
petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_asm_overlap -sub_pc_type -sub_pc_factor_levels'
petsc_options_value = 'asm      2               ilu          4'
line_search = 'none'
nl_rel_tol = 1e-5
nl_abs_tol = 1e-6
nl_max_its = 6
l_tol = 1e-6
l_max_its = 500
[]
[Outputs]
file_base = lid_driven_out
exodus = true
perf_graph = true
[]`

Hello
You cannot pass the whole function to the BodyForce kernels.
You need to define them in the Functions block as ParsedFunction objects, then pass that to the BodyForce kernel
Guillaume

Hi @GiudGiud ,
Thank you for your reply.
According to your suggestions, I have defined the functions in the Functions block as ParsedFunction object. This creates a new problem: the functions include the velocity components Vx and Vy, but the velocity components created in AuxVariables are not identified by the ParsedFunction object.

Functions do not support dependencies on variables unfortunately.
You will need to use a material property instead. Such as this one
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/ParsedMaterial.html
then use a MatBodyForce kernel (we dont have it, you ll need to create it)
You could try using https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/kernels/ADMatCoupledForce.html but with a coupled variable of 1 (so the term becomes 1 * material_property) but not sure it will work
Thank you very much for your reply. I will try to solve this problem according to your suggestions.

Hi Johnney, did you fix this? I'm having a similar issue and can't get it right. If you have could I please see your working code?
Best wishes,
Oscar

Hi, Oscar. I haven't coded yet.
Best,
Johnney

node.title: Complement moving boundary in CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I had a question about the complement_moving_boundary parameter in the CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier.
[UserObjects]
  [activate_elements]
    type = CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier
    coupled_var = 'act_var'
    criterion_type = 'above'
    threshold = 0.5
    subdomain_id = 1 # active block 
    complement_moving_boundary_name = 'moving_interface'
  []
[]

In scenario 1 (see image), I am moving elements from the blue subdomain to the grey subdomain, and the green boundary is the complement_moving_boundary. This updates well as the elements move. However, I would like the elements that are activated to move into a different subdomain to the grey one as it will have different properties.
In scenario 2 (see image), I have started off with some elements already in the red domain, and elements move from the blue to the red. The complement_moving_boundary does update to account for the new red domain, but the part of it previously between the red and grey is not removed.
I was wondering how I could set the parameters so the complement_moving_boundary doesn't keep parts that are between the red and grey? I am also block restricting my variables to the red and grey domains.

Thank you.
Wendy
@hugary1995 it looks like you're the author of this class?

Yes.
@Wendy-Ji I'll look into this next week. As I mentioned last time we talked, feel free to tag me directly in the post. I'm committed to a few improvements and bug fixes for this ESM this year.
I haven't forgotten this thread yet. I was tied to something else in the past weeks. I hope to get to this in the next few days.

node.title: Get the detail logs
node.bodyText:
How can I get the detail logs which are printed on the terminal?
Such as below information showed on the terminal after a simulation finished:
0 Nonlinear |R| = 9.214686e-01
0 Linear |R| = 9.214686e-01
1 Linear |R| = 2.506059e-01
2 Linear |R| = 3.767411e-02
3 Linear |R| = 3.042510e-03
4 Linear |R| = 2.674655e-04
5 Linear |R| = 3.080687e-05
1 Nonlinear |R| = 5.707467e-04
0 Linear |R| = 5.707467e-04
1 Linear |R| = 9.549090e-06
2 Linear |R| = 1.710096e-06
3 Linear |R| = 5.100882e-07
4 Linear |R| = 4.510555e-07
5 Linear |R| = 3.378032e-07
6 Linear |R| = 2.988210e-07
.....................
Linear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_ITS iterations 50
4 Nonlinear |R| = 4.671953e-09
Solve Converged!
Currently Executing
Finished Solving

Hello
You can create a Console block in the [Outputs] section and specify the output_file parameter
see https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/outputs/Console.html
Guillaume
That's what I find, thank you!

node.title: A question about Jacobian of order parameter wrt. other variables

node.bodyText: @laagesen
Thank you！

I'd suggest you use this utility to make sure your Jacobian implementation is correct:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/help/development/analyze_jacobian.html
Thank you！

node.title: Specify variable initial condition of new activated element in ActivateElementByPath
node.bodyText: Hello, I am currently working on ActivateElementByPath related work, I am wondering that whether the variable for new activate element  could be specified in the userobject, for example, a pure thermal problem, the element id is transferred from 0 to 1, then could the temperature be also transferred to a specified value as initial condition of this element in the UserObject block instead of defining it in the ics? If I would like to implement this, is there any existing code or what kind of code should I modify or add to the source file?
@dewenyushu

in my opinion this would not be too hard to do. You just need to modify the user object to set the value of the variable after creating the element.
or more likely a second user object that acts after the system has been re-sized and sets the value of the variable based on some other variable that distinguishes a new element from an old one (like some sort of boolean field)

I'm using PopOS! which is basically ubuntu so no WSL issues
I'm not using a proxy or vpn.
I tried setting an environment variable MAMBA_NO_LOW_SPEED_LIMIT=1 based on this response
I'm getting no response or anything downloaded, it says 0B
I'm able to access https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/ on a web browser
I do use zsh but i've tried changing shells and get the same issue
I only get this when interacting with the https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64 channel. I am able to set up other environments using conda-forge.

                UID:GID : 1000:1000
             netrc file : None
           offline mode : False


An unexpected error has occurred. Conda has prepared the above report.

Hello
Can you reach this address from your browser?
https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64
Guillaume

Can you try using curl to access the site?
curl https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/noarch/repodata.json
I was able to access the website and the json using curl no issues.

Can post your ~/.condarc file? I doubt there is anything out of the ordinary.
This is definitely weird and I've run into this before. But I don't recall the solution. Can we try doing this in a super-clean environment:
env -i bash --norc --noprofile
export HOME=/home/akh
export PATH=/home/akh/mambaforge3/bin:$PATH
mamba create -n moose moose-dev
Still times out?

my condarc file:
channels:
  - https://conda.software.inl.gov/public
  - conda-forge

I tried with the clean env and I got the exact same error as above which ends up with:
RuntimeError: Download error (28) Timeout was reached [https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/noarch/repodata.json]
    Resolving timed out after 9096 milliseconds

I have no idea why curl would work, but not mamba (which is using Python requests module... I think).
I suppose we can try using requests, just to see if its a Python issue:
Run python and then enter the following:
import requests
url = 'https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64/repodata.json'
r = requests.get(url)
r.status_code

My place of work, requires us to supply a Chain Root certificate... so for the above to work for me, I have to:
import requests
url = 'https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64/repodata.json'
r = requests.get(url, verify='/path/to/my/ca_root.crt')
r.status_code
I am only posting this, in the hopes this might make sense to you. If you are coming from a corporation or other non-personal use entity, you may be required to supply a certificate like we do, in order to establish a connection. If that is the case, Conda makes use of the following environment variable:
export REQUESTS_CA_BUNDLE=/path/to/your/company/root_cert.crt
mamba <commands>

I don't need a certificate here on my network and I've actually gotten the same error on multiple networks.
It looks like requests is working fine:
>>> import requests
>>> url = 'https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64/repodata.json'
>>> r = requests.get(url)
>>> r.status_code
200

I'm puzzled. I might try deleting mamba and reinstalling one more time although I've done it once already.

wow, thats just wild. Yes, Conda is most certainly using requests as its connector...
I know you are using the 'right' Python stuff too, with the wholeenv -i bash --norc --noprofile trick we did.

I have installed MOOSE successfully before and it worked fine. I ran into this issue when trying to update it so I just deleted and reinstalled conda but kept my MOOSE repo.
So I wonder if I need to delete everything MOOSE related and try from scratch. Not sure if that would make a difference?

If you haven't already deleted Conda, can you load up the base (default) environment and run a mamba list | grep openssl
Mine for good measure:
❯ mamba list | grep openssl
openssl                   3.1.2                h53f4e23_0    conda-forge
pyopenssl                 23.2.0             pyhd8ed1ab_1    conda-forge

I know we have had an issue in the past with older/newer/some_version...
I am also facing mamba timeout issue. I removed my environment and wanted to create new environment.

What eventually worked for me (no idea why) was:

uninstall and reinstall mamba
move to a different wifi network
delete MOOSE repo and re install

node.title: Get Inputparameters from anthor material
node.bodyText:
Dear moose developers,
I am developing code based on ComputeCrackedStress, and not quite well understand the logic on how to pass the material parameters from other material.
It use getMaterialPropertyByName to fetch the stress, and strain from stress model.
But if i want to get material parameters from other model, for examples, _number_slip_systems from a crystal plasticity mode
Is it the same way by using the getMaterialPropertyByName?
Thanks.

Hello
Unless _number_slip_systems is declared as material property itself, then no it wont work with getMaterialPropertyByName.
One of the cannon way to do this is to make that attribute a material property as well.
We dont have a way to 'forward' input parameters from one object to another.
if you obtain a pointer to the first material using this routine on the FEProblem
  std::shared_ptr<MaterialBase> getMaterial(std::string name,
                                            Moose::MaterialDataType type,
                                            THREAD_ID tid = 0,
                                            bool no_warn = false);

AND
write a getter on that material for the attribute you want, then you can dynamic_past that first pointer to the type needed and call the getter.
Guillaume
for that particular attribute, it might be stored elsewhere than the material as well. I reclassified the post under tensor mechanics to see if others know

The _number_slip_systems is stored only as an unsigned integer, not as a material property. You could, however, query the length of one of the MaterialProperty vectors that contains a value for each slip system to get the same information.  As an example the vector _tau[_qp] can be retrieved through getMaterialPropertyOld<std::vector<Real>>(_base_name + "applied_shear_stress")
Hope this helps,
Stephanie
